message_1: Suppose a town has three weather conditions: sunny, cloudy, and rainy. The probability of today being sunny given that yesterday was cloudy is 0.4, the probability of today being cloudy given that yesterday was sunny is 0.3, the probability of today being rainy given that yesterday was cloudy is 0.2, and the probability of today being sunny given that yesterday was rainy is 0.1. If today is sunny, what is the probability that yesterday was rainy?

P(A|B) = P(B|A) * P(A) / P(B)

In this case, we want to find P(Yesterday was Rainy | Today is Sunny). We are given the following probabilities:

P(Today is Sunny | Yesterday was Cloudy) = 0.4
P(Today is Cloudy | Yesterday was Sunny) = 0.3

P(Yesterday was Rainy | Today is Sunny) = P(Today is Sunny | Yesterday was Rainy) * P(Yesterday was Rainy) / P(Today is Sunny)

Now we can find P(Today is Sunny):

P(Today is Sunny) = 0.4 * (1/3) + 0.4 * (1/3) + 0.1 * (1/3) = 0.3
